A1IX4ZfpjEGj9vmtXReZzw.text: For fast food Chicfila is pretty good.  The one thing that truly sets them apart is their staff. The employees are always polite, pleasant,  & seemingly happy. This restaurant is no exception. Whatever do they at corporate level certainly reflects in the franchises. More  businesses would benefit from this level of customer service.

Zm-1JgES5lZAngDK7pztoA.text: Always good - customer service was spectacular. Not your typical fast food experience they actually come to your table to make sure you have everything you need/ordered and are satisfied. The food was delicious. Closed Sunday. I would recommend trying this if you never have been to chick-fil-a. Salads are fresh and the chicken is moist.

RwaYnl1wSIljScq89nqNdw.text: I go to this chik-fil-a often on lunch and they are always very busy but very efficient. Everyone is super friendly and kind, never had a bad experience at this location

5vdY3wrfxgvWGO2VdR73ag.text: Today was extremely busy at this location. The line was all the way out in the road. I was a little frustrated from my day when I came through the drive-through and when lady behind me honked her horn I definitely lost my temper. To say the least it's been a stressful day. The man who took my order outside was beyond nice, even when I didn't deserve it. When I got to the window Chick-fil-A through a "random act of kindness" (also known as you're clearly having a bad day let us do something nice for you)  gave me my meal for free. Even in a moment where I let my temper get the best of me these wonderful people managed to do something so extremely nice that it completely blew my mind. To the man who took my order, I am so sorry and I am embarrassed for my actions. You are a truly wonderful person! To the entire staff at this Chick-fil-A you guys deserve a medal for your kindness. I paid for the ladies meal behind me as a cheap "I'm sorry". I guess I'm saying all this the staff can know how far their kindness really went. I will definitely remember this. Thank you..

yl69hontMlgwc2iXexwlvw.text: Always awesome - super Drive Thru service with a smile. I love the location right off 485 - great if you're running late from work in the evening!!

wWSGQ5-uwDNQRi_3RujOmw.text: It's Chick Fil A, is a review necessary?  I don't have any of these back home. I always make it a point to go when I'm in town.  The staff is always friendly and efficient.  My order is always correct, the food is always good. I ALWAYS bring home a bag of their chocolate chip cookies. I get in trouble if I come home without them.

UzRN4zDOI9XQI01V2XI9Qw.text: This location seemed really new!  The building and parking lot very new compared to it's surroundings, but everything was very clean and the staff super nice.  We did have an unusually long wait for our food, but when it was brought out, it was piping hot and fresh.  Though Chick-fil-a tends to fall on the high end, pricewise when it comes to fast food, it still is a winning combination (in my opinion).  Not many businesses can shut down on Sundays and still survive.

z0p1FL5tjhCNUdcscmiNlA.text: Awesome chik fila.  Due to the fact at lunch time they have people outside taking orders on tablets which speeds up the line. Also, they havent fucked up my order ever which is weird in clt

kEZ--PvyxJ-POhGTo9Fuwg.text: This is my go-to spot for "dates" with my 2 1/2 year-old son.  The staff is ALWAYS courteous and friendly and they go out of their way more often than not.  The last time the woman at the register gave my son a stuffed cow and then later a balloon - that made his day!!!  They have great family-themed events (Pirate & Princess night, Mom's Morning Out, etc., Mommy & Son Date Night to name a few) and we really just love going there.   They bring your food to your table, which is great when you have your hands full with a little one!!  The bathrooms are always clean and the food is of course delicious!  The only complaint I would have is that a lot of older kids seem to end up in the play area.  We went a few weeks ago and there were kids in there (unsupervised) that were at least 9 or 10 that were climbing up the slide, on top of the slide, running around and just being really rambunctious.  Granted, kids are kids and they were just having fun, but a little girl was coming down the slide when one of the boys was climbing up and she ran right into him.  We ended up leaving because my son started trying to copy the little boys and it was just getting a little too rough.  Not sure what the solution could be. Perhaps they could be a bit better about patrolling who goes in to play? This has only been the case a few times and has not deterred us from returning.   Overall, the best Chick-Fil-A in our area!!

r92quAtXTzQf5febJpJUUQ.text: Great food as usual but the service at this location is not what you expect from a    chic-fil-a.

ftcIJKZ47A1doE4Q0sG4Qw.text: I'm assuming the food is the same at the locations, and the food we had was the same quality as all the other Chick-Fil-A's we've been to.  You get a number, and they bring your food to you.  The first thing I noticed was the play area. It was really nice, but then we noticed a sign that only 3 and under could be in there, and we didn't get that. My kid is 5, and is still in that age to play, but whatever...  I like this Chick-Fil-A because it wasn't crowded. And this is the main reason for my review. It wasn't like the other Chick-Fil-A's that are the mecca for stay at home moms which they turn into stay at home mom HELL.  If you want to avoid that crowd (like the Mooresville location), and if it's possible, come to this one.

Rzx6IXAaoaEjEUCzJeDxKg.text: Awesome service! The manager, Rafael,  was walking around checking on tables and made sure everyone was happy.  My food was delayed a bit and he took care of me and gave me a free meal for my next visit there.

FenmROwwFU5Abr8-dzWQmw.text: I am a frequent visitor of Chik Fil a and have been to many locations up and down the east coast. I love chik Fil a as they have the best customer service and usually speedy order fulfillment. This location however is slower than most during the lunch time rush so make sure you get there with enough time if you're rushing! Only one attendant at the drive thu as well and limited parking!

JGlLYhiREfBAYVh-cT6tZg.text: Sad to see you this CFA continue to go downhill.it used to have the friendliest, happy, helpful people. Now they don't pay attention, best word I can think of is surly. Now it will be my pleasure to go to Woodlawn. Wish I could give S Blvd 2 1/2 stars. also 93.5 rating. I expect high 90s at a CFA.

Sn3bG7U36KYF5Wy9LYrxDA.text: Some days you are just craving Chick-Fil-A, and as Jenny B. said, most of the time I do is on Sundays, when they are closed.  Luckily for me, I had a craving this week and didn't ignore it.  This location is the closest to me and every time I have been the service is friendly and the food is always great. Although I have tried a variety of items I am an 8 piece chicken nugget meal gal!  This most recent visit the nuggets were fresh and warm, the fries cooked to perfection.  I always ask for a side of pickles, because that is something I miss from the chicken sandwich.  So, yes, this may sound strange, but I put a pickle on the nugget and dip in the barbeque sauce, heaven. Another treat, their Cole Slaw. Add a side of cole slaw to your next meal, you will not be disappointed. A side order is actually pretty large that I always have left-overs, which I love.  Overall, I know why the drive thru is always packed, and the lines at the Chick-fil-A food courts are always the busiest. Chick-fil-A doesn't disappoint and the food can meet the needs for all, offering grilled chicken, fried chicken, soups, salads, desserts and more.  Enjoy!

JdthozLDpjhJ_dR_mEIiag.text: This has got to be one of the worst Chick-fil-A's I have visited!    The set up (parking lot, the drive thru and lack of staffing) is ridiculous!!!  The drive-thru is very slow resulting in huge back ups on South Boulevard. Most Chick-fil-A's have at least two order-takers standing out in the drive-thru to expedite service. The wait time to get your food inside is just as long.  If you are on your lunch hour, I would suggest going somewhere else.

c-a4Md4KKP43aeelHEX_Ng.text: Chick-fail-A has never done me wrong. We know the number 1 is the best and lemonade is always good.

LL4o6bM8iusSmtY20Sj-BQ.text: I can't drink the Coke I didn't order because I have diabetes and I don't enjoy spontaneous trips to the ER on Monday mornings, so thanks for wasting my money. D+

9cznFKFHMgNKHjQ-xgQDrA.text: I am a huge chick fil a fan but this is honestly one of the worst chick fil a locations I have been to. Thought maybe the one time I went was just a fluke but went back and the quality was exact same. There's nothing like ordering the breakfast scramble with cold eggs and cheese straight out of the fridge that couldn't even come close to being melted. It's sad such a great food chain really struggles at this location. In addition to subpar food they are one of the slowest chains I have ever been to.

wKFPOaaTRL4elHHP29NgdA.text: I love chick fil a and the service has always been the best for fast food but this place has by far the most rude and disrespectful employees. Never returning. In addition my food was cold.

ZVtqr7tp5jW-2rDAlKkHAg.text: I love chickfila but this was not a good experience. Very slow service, order was incorrect, employee was stone cold. My husband spent more time waiting at the counter for anything than at the table.

p_Mzyab07blmoY7twvbAhQ.text: The drive-thru service is AMAZING, ESPECIALLY during prime hours! They have incredibly polite and knowledgeable staff (sometimes the manager too) outside to take your order as soon as you pull up, before you reach the speaker. They are never anything other than polite and consummate customer service professionals, even when you have numerous orders! Every other fast food chain could learn a thing or two from CFA!

nD1F7EJLesdAJfLEgLSURg.text: Waited 10 minutes and never got my milkshake. I came in specifically for the milkshake. I jumped back in line to wait patiently to see what happened and Katrina who I assumed would be helping me out next waved her friends which were waiting behind me over to her register and proceeded to take their order and ignore me. I love Chick-fil-A. I have never received such terrible unfriendly service at any Chick-fil-A in my life. No wonder this location has terrible reviews.

56QhKsba4LCpHTMvii1-Yg.text: Good food and a very popular spot on South Blvd. They feature the normal CFA cuisine, which is a very good thing. The management is very generous with supporting charities and the staff is very friendly on a consistent basis.

Slu4JsBUfJGufotyJd8qHA.text: Some days you just crave chickfila then realize it's a Sunday and you suddenly get depressed. Luckily, I came here on a Saturday. The drive thru line was literally to the street so I decided to walk in and order. The line inside was about 10 people deep, but the line went super fast. I was in and out within 10 minutes. This location is ALWAYS busy, but they are always very quick and be food is made fresh.

AKZFGy-pB7eIqsEXdbS9Zg.text: Got to give the South Blvd location 3 stars, against the benchmark location (Cotswold). Staff, wait time, and cleanliness are decent; but far from exceptional

ZaDa1HtaoWo3GRNM81sSFg.text: This chick- fill- A is disappointing. I was there and I was ignored 3 times. Wen my rust came yo to order the girl taking the orders just left, dint even say anything to me. Another girl came to the front to take orders and asked the person behind me if he needed anything, I was ignored again. And again.

Ao2a1qRhsjKf86Uv23Bb3g.text: Unfortunately the only Chick-fil-A nearby and the worst one I've been to. Customer service is nowhere near what Chick-fil-A is known for. Food is subpar.

KyyE7IKzqEFvDjf5_ey6Gg.text: I love this location however the drive through lane always seems to be eight cars deep so I run in to dine or grab some yummy, Chick Fil A goodness to go. As always, the staff is friendly, accommodating and throwing out My pleasures like there is no tomorrow. I found out the other day they offer whole wheat bun options which is fabulous and I think it's only $.20 extra. They also offer you fruit instead of fries with your combo which is also fabulous however their waffle fries are one of the reasons I heart the Chick Fil A so fries it shall be forever! If you go to the condiment bar, they have pre-wrapped good quality mints (which I may or may not take a handful or two when I go in there). They also have free wifi---always a plus!   Show me a carnivore who doesn't like Chick Fil A and I will show you a crackhead.

photos.caption: Photo of Chick-fil-A - Charlotte, NC, United States

cAarkqTPA7pRC6sO0RgVSA.text: The food is amazing because it's Chick Fil A but this location needs improvement. The drive thru line is insane, blocking traffic on South Blvd.

rrizoKNyoa6FfnasTYjsVQ.text: Chick-fil-a. Thanks for being decent and giving your employees a day off. Although, you've created a serious problem for me... I always want nuggets, waffle fries and Chik-fil-a sauce on that day... Oh well. Aside for that little problem, this location is great. The service is always spot-on and the food is always tasty.

rof2764wh-EG-WEUA6bT2Q.text: This chick fil a is becoming like most chick fil a resteraunts. Customer service is going down and they did not even get my order correct! The black girl and the Latino guy in the drive thru were so busy trying to keep the line moving that they did not offer a smile or greeting or anything other than a question of what I ordered. And whatever happened to the words "My pleasure?"  One star is for the taste of the food and the other star is for the price. That's it

lrrtl2twh7lVbxMma15Bbw.text: Breakfast time  They were busy but not crazy Employee was confused on my order-sausage bowl, yogurt parfait, water.  Took 15 minutes to get my food.  Get my food, no hash browns in the bowl Go back up, after 5 minutes of waiting for someone to acknowledge me, I tell her and she tells me the are out of hash browns..seriously? And, as I'm sitting here eating, then keep pumping food out, only tells people when they get their food, that the are out of hash browns.  Could you not tell people when the are placing their order? Annoying

kRjajOB-lePJ5_D5NsPfAg.text: Can always count on Chick-fil-A for consistency in taste and good service. Grabbed a cookies and cream milkshake from here, and it was really good - as usual! Me and a friend even gave the play-place a testing because it was late (playplace closed) so we did a quick race through it. LOL

vr47SDrdUEfrfMkGPfw6og.text: LOVE, LOVE, LOVE CFA, dislike this location A LOT!! I was so excited when they built this location, as it's close to where I live.  Excitement has been short-lived and although I've given them additional chances, issues continue.  Fast food experiences should not be this complicated.    Getting in and out of this parking lot is a nightmare.  There's one way in and one out.  Traffic backs up to South Blvd during most hours of the day, from the drive thru lane and customers. Having someone in the parking lot taking orders does not speed up this drive thru window.  The Drive-thru line is so SUPER slow!   If you think you're being smart by going inside, it too is a madhouse! This location just isn't prepared to handle the volume of customers that it attracts.    Parking lot is another roller coast that one should be prepared to deal with.  As my visit today will show you, multiple people have created their own parking spots since the parking lot was full.  Another KIND customer parked directly behind my car, keeping me from leaving because they had blocked me in!!   TIP!! Double check your order before you leave.  I've often gotten home and been missing portions of my order- only to have to drive back and deal with said obstacles above, again!   SECOND TIP!! Do yourself a favor, if you're really craving CFA, drive to the Woodlawn Location.  Your CFA experience will be much better there.   Three stars because their quality of food is ...well, CFA good but even their condiment station needed help today.  It was dirty with spilled creamer, sugar and empty napkins holders.  I can expect that at McD but not CFA!  Good luck getting attention from an employee, they're all busy trying to fill orders!

p9HwQT4w_i5mTXlNwt9MYA.text: Two out of five times they get my order wrong And they charge me for hashbrowns when I don't want them in my burrito and I just want them on the side it has been my worst experience at a Chick-fil-A so far

Blp7LGprthqOunuXo-A3Uw.text: I don't review often, and CFA employees are often above average, but I wanted to give recognition to Pierre, one of the managers (I assume,by his non-red shirt) at this South Blvd location.  He is very friendly and personable.  It makes a huge difference when someone enjoys their job, and that definitely shows with Pierre.  The only reason I didn't give five stars is because our food took longer than I felt like it should have.

pQ2FcriA4QKClC8wl2lvQg.text: Charlotte South End FDU (#2044) - This is by far the worst kept Chick-Fil-A I have ever been to Chick-Fil-A has been my only choice of fast food for the last 5+ years. The #2044  store reminded me of no Chick-Fil-A I have come to know. this store has turned into a McDonald! No people skills, No greeting when you approach the cashier, Etc. The staff clothing was dirty and unfitting, one guy was drinking cups after cups of sweet tea right behind the my register (I suppose he was trying to refill the Sweet tea!). The staff spoke very loudly with each other in the front and the back, etc. etc. As a loyal Chcik-Fil-A cushier I Was not Impressed AT ALL!

tAhEmm_39EMe_9vxkV6BvA.text: The worst Chick-fil-A I've encountered. Basing this off of multiple poor experiences. Customer service is poor, fries are often cold and something is always missing from the bag. Employees don't have the typical "My pleasure," attitude.

0nOpHvoSMCjYRHZlTJYezA.text: Love love love Chick-fil-A.  Hate hate hate the lines and the traffic at this location. It's always busy no matter what time of day you go! One day, Chick-fil-A had 3 delivery trucks in their parking lot at one time. The entire parking lot became grid locked and every car was trapped in. They had to call the police to rectify the situation and direct traffic.  Instead of trying to over compensate and offer great service, the employees were staring out the windows watching the mess. :(

WXmLAYOJ85r3y2UOnaMATg.text: It's a Chick-Fil-A, you know the drill: you only seem to crave it on Sundays. Well, unless you're my friend Ashley who had it for both lunch and dinner yesterday.  I don't eat a ton of fast food, but Chick-Fil-A is in my rotation when I do. This location is kind of tricky. It's always busy. If you're trying to turn left onto South Blvd when leaving here, good luck. It probably will not happen. Traffic seems to always be non-stop crazy on South Blvd.   They have an actual person walk up to your window to take your order while you wait in the drive-thru line (allegedly speeds up the process). Personally, it makes me uncomfortable to look at the menu and debate just how many nuggets I need while a person hovers over me. Watching. Judging. Oh well.  Also, Chick Fil A sauce is superior to all other sauces here. Shout out to Sarah C for teaching me that very valuable piece of info. Can't believe I've been wasting all these years on Polynesian sauce.

ScGz_8ZQgtJX33l-jeCH_Q.text: Wow, I can see why this location ranks so much lower than the chain's average. The owner must be proud.  For 20 minutes I periodically kept trying to phone their office, getting a busy signal. They'd mistakenly put pepperjack cheese on a sandwich - that's all - and I simply wanted to call ahead in advance of my next visit, rather than handling it at the counter - to avoid holding up the line and having to explain it all twice. Once the phone line cleared though, it rang for 10 more minutes before being answered, suggesting the previous caller was also just someone trying to get through.  After clearly mentioning that I still had my receipt, I was greeted w/ this sole sentence from the disinterested manager who answered: "Okay, just bring back your receipt and we'll replace that."  Oh thanks - you're actually gonna go and do the **absolute minimum** you can - which is provide me that which I've already paid for in full, after I journey all the way back over there **due entirely to your error**, but it doesn't dawn on you in that scenario to say something like "sorry about that"?  When I asked if she'd take down my name, she declined, and despite my having specified twice that I had my receipt, she again reinforced that no product would be replaced w/o it. It's always nice when a company you **oh so frequently patronize** screws up, has you waste more time and money to correct it, offers zero apology - only to then make the matter considerably worse by hinting that customer could be lying over a $3 food item. If that was a serious concern, why didn't she just ask for the transaction # off the receipt at the top the call? Or btw if she'd take a look at my phone and last month's debit action, she'd see I WAS probably one of their more regular customers - dropping in about every 3 days.   So thanks for wasting my good will, my $$ and a lot of my time - including time just trying to get someone on the phone - only to be rudely dismissed as practically a nuisance.  When I'm back on that side of town, I'll absolutely drop off that receipt to the GM and politely decline anything offered - explaining that this woman's performance has undone my appetite for the brand. Especially at any of this franchisee's locations.

Bpk51uTP6qV6IFVyHegf1w.text: Hit or miss. I've had overly breaded chicken and half-cooked nuggets some days. They also never apologize when they make errors. If you want to be treated as an inconvenience, this is definitely the spot. You get eye rolls, attitude and the managers clearly don't care to make it better. This location is huge disappointment for their reputation.  Update**  They know how to mistreat you. No improvements in staff whatsoever. I had to wait 20 minutes for my order and when they came to the car they asked someone else if it was their order when I had told them I was waiting on food. I gave her my name and all she said was "idk" and asked someone else. So rude!

t0NHL6K4l60shjZx6eZLmA.text: Went through the drive thru, paid for my simple nugget order, At pickup window they had me and I realized four others drive to the front to wait for our orders, after 5-10 mins nothing.  Went in to demand a refund and they didn't even apologize.

md65An7hW0GmS3m7eblDlg.text: This is the worst Chick Fil a I have ever been to. The past three times I have been, I've either had either an incorrect order, bad customer service, or low quality food. This is very unusual for chick fil a's seeing as to they are the "fast food of all fast foods."  I have waited between 15-20 minutes (after paying and pulling to the front door) for a chicken mini meal (during peak-breakfast time when everyone else is clearly receiving their orders), I have also received 3 minis when I clearly bought 4... (receipt to show!), and have also ordered cookies that were hard as ROCKS! Seriously could break teeth.   I normally never review, but I felt the need to express my concerns for this CFA!

E-Ak7SmdQF9BASGOZEivhw.text: Worst location ever. Restaurant was trashed and evidently this location doesn't require customer service skills to be hired.

6_2YOCWtEZjaI1dvSFw7WQ.text: Literally so slow. We put an order in on the app on our way there and STILL had to wait 20mins for our food. Most chick filas do a great job with service but this one was unacceptable. What is the point in having an order ahead option on the app when it still takes forever. No ketchup was available, trash and were overflowing. It was disgusting. They ALSO got our order totally wrong and forgot things after waiting forever. I would give negative stars for this experience if I could.

OZAcrq5De4ppn13w2gHJ4g.text: I ordered the chicken nugget meal today. To my surprise when I got to the destination I had everything in the bag except the chicken nuggets.  Unfortunately no time to grab lunch twice or two trips to Chick-fil-A.   Check your order before leaving this drive-thru.

j77BKkKL80uUQLI5VwJlJA.text: Love this place!!! The line is long but it shortens, quickly ... this is the only fast food Resturant, I attend  ...

KTx-IjDdM9Qq_T23aJDQ4A.text: I visited this chick-fil-a for a milkshake this evening and it was an unpleasant experience. After ordering my milk shake I waited a longer amount of time than usual ~5-8 minutes, even though the restaurant wasn't busy. Turns out that someone that works there was making themselves a milkshake before leaving their shift, which caused the hold up. The cashier brought my friend and I our milkshakes without whipped cream and a cherry even though that was what was ordered. We had several people behind the counter staring at us wondering what we were waiting on, who never approached us to ask until the last minute. They were somewhat rude when they asked what we were waiting for to which I answered two milkshakes that we had to send back to get additional toppings on. This took another 2-3 minutes. Overall professionalism of the workers was not up to par for Chick-fil-a. It felt like I was in a McDonalds or Burger King, customer service wise. Also once we got our milk shakes they were not thick at all, way too liquidity, and sloppily put together (whipped cream and cherry).

95Sis6W3cLgbI0IHq7CimA.text: Out of all the Chick-fil-As I frequently visit this location is quickly becoming my least favorite. It all had to stem from the food. The service is still spot on. I'm just convinced they can't cook good breakfast. Last week I went threw the drive thur and ordered 2 hash browns. Both packets were cold and greasy. I called and they said they would replace them. Today I got the replacements and they weren't cold but still weren't up to par like the other locations. My mother and I also both ordered breakfast sandwiches and both of the biscuits were thick and doughy. I love Chick-fil-A but probably will not be coming to this location for breakfast for awhile.

Dl6I3KgBdr2fBwFkeGYEAg.text: LOVE ME SOME CHICK-FIL-A!  Best fries ever. Can't go wrong with the honey roasted BBQ. Food is always fresh and everyone is always polite!  Love the rewards system as well!

-TdIWI6lRp2frDg5LOsvjw.text: This is probably one of my favorite places to eat. The (Chick-fil-a in general) always get your order correct. But today I walked into this particular one for lunch and presented my veteran's I'd as I always do and was told that the policy has changed and you have to be in uniform to receive a military discount. Granted not every establishment offers a discount for military or veterans but to be told that you have to be in uniform to receive a privileged discount that they offer is unsettling. No matter the fact you have some portion of you life to serve your country and that you was one of the lucky ones to make it back only to be told no because you're not in uniform. Keep in mind that any service men or women have to have documentation showing they served to receive a veterans ID. I believe chick-fil-a needs to review their policies all together.   This incident has left a bitter taste in my mouth and I'll be sure to find somewhere else to eat

aJQ8Nnp2bp4QV8AkvSh87w.text: I am a huge fan of chick fil a and i was disappointed when I came to this location. We arrived at 9:30 and there were 3 cars in front of us. The line was moving generally fast.  I order a #1 with cheese and my boyfriend ordered a #2 with cheese. When we pulled up to the women the cashier gave us the sauces we requested but proceeded to talk to her co-workers that were all huddled around and attempting to clean the restaurant.  Her and one of her co-workers were laughing and talking. The cashier repeatedly stated "I'm not talking to you or you". I don't know if she was talking to her co-worker or us. Before I could respond she handed us our food without a thank you or anything.  When we came home, our food was prepared sloppy. I did not have cheese like I asked and even the box had with cheese. My boyfriend's cheese on his sandwich was only on a 1/4 of the chicken and the rest was off the sandwich.  We were utterly disappointed. I see why this store has such a low rating. The team needs to go through customer service 101 because this is not the Chick Fil A i am used to.

TvvhfPyUDtFDzUCRbuqQ3g.text: Love Chick-fil-a and I'm a vegetarian! Staff is very friendly and helpful. I recommend going inside. Even though they have one of the fastest drive thru's it's still faster to place an order inside.

Hdvy9saYjjGTvP8Eebj7hg.text: These stars are not only for the food but for amazing customer service by Pierre. Upon placing my order Pierre asked "how was my day going?" I replied "sucky" while I was getting my cash to pay for my meal. When I was about to hand it to him I saw that he put in the system Random Acts(free meal)  and told me that "he hopes this will make my day a little better". I wanted to cry right there...never had someone do that for me(I did cry in the car though. Lol). Kudos to Pierre for trying to make my day a little better and bringing a much needed smile

photos.caption: Photo of Chick-fil-A - Charlotte, NC, United States. No line Thursdays. Get in...get out
Photo of Chick-fil-A - Charlotte, NC, United States. It&#39;s Christmas Time

B3Ab-fgRf51SZPj9IaPeOA.text: Food is always good but the staff isn't the best at this location. Also living in south end I often come around 9ish to grab a snack and they lock the inside sometimes an hour before close which is unacceptable. You have to catch someone coming out to go in and order your food.

IdiDZc4eOIfq9y0mL10ELA.text: Can never go wrong with Chik fil A. Was running errands after work on a Monday and had 20 mins to get a healthy dinner with my husband.  Stopped in for their salads which I had never tried before.   I was pretty surprised but how good it was for an 8$ fast food salad that looked pretty healthy.  The customer service was on point as usual. And there was no one online inside. But the drive-thru line was insane. Got our salads in 5 minutes or less brought over to our table.   This particular location has a children's play area outside,  but it was so cold inside that we sat out there.  Wish there were tables for non-children-having-people outside.  Got the Southwest salad with chicken. The salad came with seeds in a package on the side,  tortilla chips on the side and dressing on the side,  all in little packages. The container was good to save the salad in case you don't finish it.

photos.caption: Photo of Chick-fil-A - Charlotte, NC, United States. Southwest salad
Photo of Chick-fil-A - Charlotte, NC, United States. Southwest salad

hUvRbWLnv00gn5kw6sEc3A.text: Unfortunately, this Chick-fil-A has been hit or miss. Had a good experience the first few times and then it turned sour. I go to Chick-fil-A, always expecting the best customer service because they always provide the best customer service. This location has been a little different. You don't always get smiling faces. You may also not get your whole order, as I was missing my hash browns and wasn't pleased with the error. The associate didn't apologize when I went back either, which was even more surprising. I always order a hash brown scramble bowl with sausage and no cheese. They had to remake it one time and I'm assuming they took the sausage out of the cheese bowl and put it in the new bowl without cheese. Skimping me on my sausage which wasn't the greatest either. I'll still visit this location because it's right by my job so it's convenient. Hopefully they'll become a little more consistent. They're very deserving of these 3 stars and I hope I'm able to update my review with a higher rating soon.  Updated Reciew on 12/1: I came here for breakfast on 11/30. I ordered the same thing I always get. Hash brown scramble bowl with sausage and no cheese, hash browns as the side and a sprite with light ice. I HAD NO HASHBROWNS IN MY HASHBROWN SCRAMBLE BOWL! Nor did I have hashbrowns on the side. I can't win with this location :(. I called the same morning and no one answered. I had to work so I couldn't keep calling. Waste of $6!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Chick-fil-A - Charlotte, NC, United States. It&#39;s so frustrating to get a HASH BROWN scramble bowl with no hash browns IN the bowl OR on the side!
Photo of Chick-fil-A - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Chick-fil-A - Charlotte, NC, United States

bdQaZLcLn7J04saqaDtl1g.text: This review goes out to Anya and the amazing team at this particular CFA on South Boulevard!    I called this morning at 10:30am when one of the powers that be in my office decided that we needed to feed 66 or so people lunch today in my office.  Too late for catering delivery orders, ezcater was NOT to the rescue, nor was DoorDash... so it was down to me.    I called Anya and asked if she could swing 2 large platters of nuggets, a large platter of strips, 40 classic CFA sandwiches, 2 platters each of fruit and cookies, tons of chips, etc... She said it would be ready at noon.  I got there supremely early at 11:30... they had us out the door with all of our food in easily carry-able bags by 11:45.  I was at my office and feeding hungry folks by noon.  Anya (and team) - I cannot thank you all enough!  Thanks further for helping us carry it out to my car.  You all are THE BEST!!!

vp_9OW4TTKbac42d8zwyZA.text: Kris is often the ONLY employee outside during lunch. I eat at chick filet 4 to 6 times a week. No hat, no drink, and it was 93 degrees outside that day. She somehow gives great service with a smile??? Kris is awesome. She takes orders with a line full of customers while a thousand employees are inside. I hope chick filet appreciates this young lady as much as i do

jd2s2OKpRMBDxkmp_20ufQ.text: Worst chick-fil-a location in the country. Slowest drive through ever. You'll spend easily 30+ minutes in line waiting if you make the mistake of getting trapped in the drive through.

8gdjet_Z6tyq7_W6DPV5fg.text: If I could give zero stars I would! This is the worst Chick-fil-a I have ever been too! They always screw up my order by not giving me all the items ordered and don't realize till I home with my mobile order.  When you try to call to get it corrected they never answer!!!

SZIwUpmaev1jvgom-7tEFw.text: I've never been to a Chick-fil-A in my life where I've been treated so rudely!( 2 mornings ago) The server who took my order was named Anya... she was rude and cut our party off in the middle of our order through the drive-thru. Then we got to the window our bag was handed  to us  by a man (i assume he was a manager...dont have a name he was african american gentlemen...who was NOT a gentleman)and the window door slammed shut.  We had to drive around and my supervisor had to walk into the building in order to obtain a receipt for our car order.  Of course my chicken was luke warm and the biscuit was dry...even found bits of paper in my drink. I'm not sure what's going on at this location but this is the worst Chick-fil-A I have ever been to In My Life! If you want to get what you expect from Chik-fil-a do yourself a favor and STAY AWAY FROM THIS NEGATIVE HOLE. Seems like the employees just run their own agenda there

rRLQSqwCaJ8qgL_QjYwVBg.text: Decided to give this location another try since it's kind of on my way to work and they dropped the ball again.

photos.caption: Photo of Chick-fil-A - Charlotte, NC, United States. Decided to give them another try and this is what I get‼
Photo of Chick-fil-A - Charlotte, NC, United States. Very disappointed with this order. Small nuggets, undone hash browns  and no honey .

pK_mcXS7judzAgTnxcAkMw.text: I tried to dodge this place at much as I can. But was craving yesterday so I gave in.   Access to the place: 3/5 omg traffic is sooo bad already on South Blvd and this place stays busy. Looking to turn left into the restaurant is a pain as is. Now imagine trying to turn left onto South Blvd. Well good luck on that. Hope you have patience that day..   Food: 5/5 they serve their food hot and freshly made. Which I appreciate!   Staffs: 4/5 most places I went too. They're customer service is top notch for a fast food joint. But yesterday they had their bad day apparently. Some staffs went beyond. I opted for a dine in so the food was brought to me.   Cleanliness: 4/5 they tried their best to keep the place clean. But during lunch hour. That's when it get chaotic so it's hard to keep up   Overall: I know there's a lot of locations I can pick from but when my craving kicks in and it's close to where I work. I would try to dodge peak times! And just starve til then

LjgzvLFKg8kmGHFSdLaKNA.text: This location does NOT have cherry coke, nor chipped small ice.  :(   Dear Lord, Yelp isalong me write more so no one will read.  Okay, the drive thru is built so you're stuck and can't get out if you can't order what you like.  It's long enough to sike you into believing it's not busy busy but it is.   Just go to PDQ

nVBKcFVZdUqKm4UEdLlkaw.text: One of the times that this location was not busy. Walked right up and redeemed a free 4ct due to my free monthly calendar treat. Saw advertisement for a limited time white peach tea lemonade. I asked if I could get it with diet lemonade. Yes and yes. All is well with me.

photos.caption: Photo of Chick-fil-A - Charlotte, NC, United States. Limited time white peach tea withdiet lemonade

C7kUir6Qh5JqfKk9NNkNoQ.text: I have been to these location twice in the last two weeks.  I use this location more than I would like. I work nearby and it is one of the better choices of the fast food chains I have available. The problem is the employees have a terrible attitude and often messed up my order. I have to inspect all parts of my order before I leave there and I would advise that anybody else do the same. The "whatcha want" attitude is terrible. It's not what can I do for youCustomer or "My Pleasure"but you're bothering me with your order..

mCzXFMMGIeCN8v2adC6gqg.text: This place was pretty good, the food wasn't bad. I did have an issue with the staff. No matter who I talked to they all kept telling me that I had pleasured them. From the person who took my order to the person sweeping the floor, I allegedly pleasured the entire store. It creeped me out.

zqlHHptofjSjumZoERGEww.text: They were off today with the Customer service. Why do you give one packet of salad dressing. Makes no kinda sense
